title: fa.functional analysis - Is $A$ is small on bounded functions, is there a large subdomain on which $A$ is small?
body: Let $A$ be a symmetric linear operator of norm $\leq 1$ on the space of functions $f:S\to \mathbb{R}$ , where $S$ is a set with $N$ elements. Define the inner product $\langle \cdot,\cdot\rangle$ by letting $\{x\}$ have measure $1/N$ for each $x\in S$ . Assume that, for every function $f$ such that $|f|_2=1$ and $|f|_\infty\leq K$ , we have $|\langle f,A f\rangle|\leq \alpha$ . Does it follow that there must be a $Y\subset S$ of measure $O(1/K)$ (say) such that, for $X = S\setminus Y$ and any $f:S\to \mathbb{R}$ with $|f|_2=1$ , $$|\langle f|_X, A(f|_X)\rangle|\leq 10 \alpha,$$ say? fa.functional-analysis linear-algebra eigenvalues eigenvector Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Aug 5, 2020 at 6:32 asked Aug 4, 2020 at 9:28 H A Helfgott 22.1k 4 4 gold badges 49 49 silver badges 143 143 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 4 $\begingroup$ Why doesn't this hold just by homoeneity for $Y=\emptyset $? And how do you define $A (f|_X) $? Do you put the restriction as $0$ outside $X $? $\endgroup$ Jochen Wengenroth –  Jochen Wengenroth 2020-08-04 17:23:58 +00:00 Commented Aug 4, 2020 at 17:23 $\begingroup$ I'm not sure how homogeneity would be enough - $A$ could have eigenfunctions with enormous peaks. Sure, define $A(f|_X)$ that way if you wish -- it doesn't matter, since you are going to take the inner product with $f|_X$. $\endgroup$ H A Helfgott –  H A Helfgott 2020-08-04 18:03:02 +00:00 Commented Aug 4, 2020 at 18:03 $\begingroup$ I must misunderstand something. For $t=K/|f|_\infty$ one has $|tf|_\infty\le K$ and hence $$\langle f, A(f)\rangle= t^{-2} \langle tf, A(tf)\rangle \le t^{-2}\alpha |tf|_2=\alpha|f|_2.$$ $\endgroup$ Jochen Wengenroth –  Jochen Wengenroth 2020-08-05 06:17:05 +00:00 Commented Aug 5, 2020 at 6:17 1 $\begingroup$ Yes, I stated the question wrongly. Just fixed it. Thanks! $\endgroup$ H A Helfgott –  H A Helfgott 2020-08-05 06:32:40 +00:00 Commented Aug 5, 2020 at 6:32 Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
